referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Multiplication
referralLink.description: Are you ready for DKT test? Try simulation test before you go for final test.

referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Substraction
referralLink.description: Government website for all informationunder one umbrella.

questions.qn: If one or two of your wheels run off the edge of the roadway, you should -
options: Increase your speed and drive back on the road
Slow down quickly by braking hard.
Slow down gradually and ease back onto the road.

questions.qn: If there are no lanes marked on the road, you should drive -
options: Anywhere on your side of the road.
Near to the left-hand side of the road.
Along the middle of the road.
Yes, if turn signals are fitted to your vehicle.
No, if turning left from a lane marked left turn only.
No, if arrows are marked on the roadway.
questions.qn: If you intend to turn left, are you required to give a signal?

options: Do not overtake a vehicle travelling in the same direction.
Stop at all times before crossing the bridge and only give way to pedestrians who may be crossing.
Slow down and be prepared to give way to vehicles travelling in the opposite direction.
questions.qn: What is meant by this sign on or near a bridge?

options: Sound your horn to warn other drivers
Unbuckle your seat belt so you can reverse as quickly as possible.
Take care and never reverse for a greater distance and time than is necessary.
questions.qn: When reversing, you should -
How close can you park to another vehicle when parked parallel to the kerb?
options: You must leave at least 3 metres front and back.
You must leave at least 2 metres from the front only.
You must leave at least 1 metre front and back.

questions.qn: Where there is parallel kerbside parking, are you allowed to double-park alongside a parked vehicle?
options: Yes, but for no more than 30 minutes
Yes, in daylight hours
No, not at any time.

questions.qn: Do you have any responsibilities when opening a vehicle door on a roadway?
options: No, any following traffic must stop if the door interferes with its progress
Yes, you must not open a door if you are likely to cause danger to road users or impede traffic.
No, there is no regulation to cover this situation.

questions.qn: Are you permitted to park on a median strip or traffic island?
options: Yes, but for no more than 30 minutes.
No, not at any time.
Yes, in daylight hours.

questions.qn: Are you permitted to park on a median strip or traffic island?
options: Yes, provided no taxis are using the area.
No, not at any time.
Yes, if you are carrying two or more passengers.

questions.qn: When driving at sunset or dawn on a dark day, what should you do?
options: Turn on your lights on low beam.
Keep your sunglasses on to cut down headlight glare.
Turn on your hazard warning lights

questions.qn: You are driving at night with your headlights on high beam. When should you dip your headlights?
options: When within 200 metres of an oncoming vehicle only.
When within 200 metres of the vehicle ahead or an oncoming one.
Never, you are allowed to drive with your lights on high beam at all times.

questions.qn: You are driving in a 60 km/h zone, with only one lane for traffic in your direction. You see a bus ahead (with this sign displayed on the rear) signalling its intention to pull out from a bus stop, you should -
options: Continue at your normal speed as the bus does not have priority.
Sound your horn to stop the bus from pulling out.
Slow down, and give way to the bus as it has priority.

questions.qn: Is it an offence to obstruct clear vision of your number plates?
options: No, you are allowed to cover your number plates if you want to.
Yes, at any time.
Yes, but it is legal for a towbar or bicycle rack to cover the rear number plate.

questions.qn: Before driving on a freeway, which of the following should you do?
options: Take something to calm your nerves before driving.
Make sure your vehicle has enough fuel, oil, water and the correct tyre pressure.
Take your street directory in case you get lost.
Not drive beyond the sign.
Drive with caution.
Not pass another vehicle.
questions.qn: When you see this sign you should -

options: Drive carefully, roundabout ahead.
Turn left at next street.
Pass to the left of the sign.
questions.qn: This sign means you should -

options: One way traffic ahead.
All right lane traffic must turn right at the next intersection
Right lane traffic may turn right or go straight ahead at the next intersection.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: No turns permitted.
Traffic travels in each direction.
Double lane bridge ahead.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: You must give way to traffic on your right
You may turn to the right.
You must not turn to the right.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: You must not turn to the left or the right.
You must not turn to the left.
You must not turn to the right.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: All traffic must travel in the direction of the arrow.
Follow the arrow unless you are turning right
Road curves to the left ahead.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: One lane bridge ahead, slow down.
No left turn.
You may travel only in the direction in which the arrow is pointing.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: You can go faster than 60 km/h
You are not to exceed 60 km/h.
You are on Highway 60.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: You must not drive faster than 100 km/h.
You must drive faster than 100 km/h.
The sign applies to truck drivers only, cars can travel at any speed
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: May drive only in light traffic.
Must not drive.
Should drink coffee before driving.
questions.qn: If you have used illegal drugs you -

options: You may drive only in daylight hours.
You must have a passenger to help you drive.
You must not drive.
questions.qn: If you are affected by a legal drug, such as a medicine (e.g. cold or allergy tablets) -

options: Read the label and confirm they are not prescription drugs and there are no special warnings on the label.
Ask your friend if the tablets have affected them.
Drink a large glass of milk because this reduces the adverse effects of medicines and drugs.
questions.qn: You want to drive your car but you have a very bad headache. A friend gives you some of their headache tablets to kill the pain. What should you do before you take these tablets?

options: Ask your passengers to let you know if you are not driving as well as you should.
Drive carefully around your local streets to see if you are affected.
Ask your doctor if the combination of drugs will make it dangerous to drive.
questions.qn: If you are taking several medications and you want to drive, you should -

options: Sound your horn and proceed through the red light.
Speed up to avoid traffic from the left and right.
Stop and wait for the green light
questions.qn: As you approach an intersection with traffic lights, the yellow light turns to red. You must

options: Slow down and turn left or right if it is safe.
Stop and turn left only if it is safe.
Stop and wait for a green light.
questions.qn: You approach an intersection showing a red light and the sign shown. You wish to turn left. You must -

options: Drive at a speed less than 40 km/h if you are not a resident of the local zone.
Only enter the street if you live in the local zone.
Not exceed 40 km/h and keep a special lookout for bicycle riders, pedestrians and children.
questions.qn: When you see this sign you must -

options: Drive at 10 km/h if there are pedestrians around.
Share this road with other people and vehicles and not exceed 10 km/h.
Reduce your speed to what you think is safe but never below 10 km/h.
questions.qn: This sign means you must -

options: For the next 5 kilometres you must not exceed 60 km/h unless you pass an end farm animals speed limit sign.
You can continue to drive at 100 km/h if there are fences to stop farm animals from getting on the road
Slow down to a speed that will allow you to stop to avoid crashing into farm animals on the road.
questions.qn: You hold an unrestricted licence and are driving at 100 km/h in the country and pass this sign. What should you do?

options: Your driver's licence permits you to carry children under the age of twelve months.
You have enough seat belts for all the passengers, including the baby.
You have a baby restraint properly fitted to your vehicle.
questions.qn: You want to give a lift to a friend and his four month old baby. Before you do, you need to make sure -

options: Any seat belt in the back or front of the car.
An anchorage point designed for a baby restraint.
Only at the back using the seat belt provided.
questions.qn: You want to fit a baby restraint to your car. What should you secure the restraint to?

options: Check your seatbelt is back in place.
Check your mirrors and blind spots for pedestrians, bicycles or other vehicles.
Check your headlights are turned off.
questions.qn: Before getting out of your vehicle you must -

options: Less dangerous than sober pedestrians because they are more careful after drinking.
Unlikely to walk near the road and do not require your attention.
One of the most common groups involved in road accidents.
questions.qn: Pedestrians who are affected by alcohol, are -

options: Move into the left lane.
Slow down, watch for pedestrians and be ready to make a safe stop.
Keep your eyes on the speedo.
questions.qn: When driving near pedestrian crossings, intersections, or school crossings, you should always -

options: No, you have right of way.
No, only the vehicle on the right.
Yes, whether they are turning or not.
questions.qn: If turning right at a T-intersection (as shown) must you give way to vehicles approaching from both the left and right?

options: No, but you must give way if turning.
Yes, it has the same meaning as the sign itself.
No, you only need to give way to the vehicle on your right.
questions.qn: If a STOP or GIVE WAY sign has been knocked down, for example, as the result of an accident, does the line marked across the road have any meaning?

options: Move to the left and stop.
Brake quickly to let the other vehicle overtake.
Keep left and allow plenty of room to let the other vehicle back in.
questions.qn: When being overtaken by another vehicle what should you do to help?

options: Sound your horn, move out andovertake.
Check to see it is safe, change gear if necessary, and signal your intention before moving out.
Signal and slow down so you will have more room to overtake.
questions.qn: Before beginning to overtake another vehicle, you should -

options: Close your eyes for a short time until they recover.
Watch the centre line of the road.
Slow down, until your eyes recover.
questions.qn: At night, if an oncoming vehicle's headlights dazzle you, you should -

options: Turn on the air conditioning or open the windows.
Stop, rest, and change drivers if possible.
Turn on the radio very loud.
questions.qn: If you get sleepy while driving, it is best to -
